title: Senior Operations Research Specialist
description:
Requisition 38213: Senior Operations Research Specialist¬†
A resume helps you stand out to hiring managers and recruiters; your resume communicates your experience and your brand. While it is not required, we encourage you to include an up-to-date resume along with a¬† completed job application to give you the best opportunity to be considered. A complete resume helps us to better understand your unique¬† background, relevant experiences, and passions. We look forward to learning about you.
¬†
Norfolk Southern offers a unique opportunity to be part of our proud legacy that spans nearly 200 years. We are a customer-centric, operations-driven team dedicated to advancing safety, serving communities, and driving innovation for tomorrow's rail.¬†¬†As part of Norfolk Southern, you‚Äôll join a collaborative team where there are opportunities for growth across the organization. We are building a culture where everyone can thrive by owning and driving exceptional results, being humble and leading with trust, serving our customers with excellence, and collaborating and coaching to win.
Job Description
Norfolk Southern Corporation is seeking a Senior Operations Research Specialist based in Atlanta, Georgia. This position will be responsible for providing management with recommendations for the use of analytical models and decision support systems to drive productivity and efficiency, achieve operational excellence, increase revenues, and reduce costs. This individual will be required to telecommute to the office in alignment with Norfolk Southern‚Äôs office/remote hybrid work policy.¬†
Responsibilities

Provide production support and enhancements for existing operations research applications.
Design new mathematical or machine learning models and implement them in programming languages such as C/C++, Java, and Python.
Evaluate the accuracy and quality of data sources and develop appropriate remedies for data gaps.
Collaborate with business partners in various departments to identify opportunities for process improvement.
Work with application development teams to integrate developed models into a production environment.
Perform a leadership role and supervise a group of people to achieve goals by creating an environment that promotes positive communication, encourages bonding of team members, and demonstrates flexibility.
Ensures work efforts are compliant with approved corporate policies, departmental standards, and procedures.
Apply understanding of industry best practices, optimization, methodologies, and emerging technologies in operations research.¬†
Provide leadership to various groups to achieve goals by creating an environment that promotes positive communication, encourages bonding of team members, and demonstrates flexibility.
	¬†

Education: 

Advanced degree, e.g., Ph.D. or M.S. in industrial engineering, operations research, information systems, mathematics, statistics, or other science and engineering fields is preferred.¬†
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or management information system is required.¬†

¬†
Skills Required:¬†

Minimum of five (5) years of experience with operations research modeling, simulation, and advanced analytics in the transportation or railroad industry. ¬†
This experience must include at least five (5) years of experience:
	
Developing decision support systems using operations research models.
Managing projects and providing hands-on leadership in the design and development of operations research models and decision support systems.
Utilizing operations research techniques and engineering skills in delivering decision support systems.
Analyzing existing operations research applications and providing production support and enhancements.
Designing new mathematical and machine learning models and implementing them in programming languages such as C/C++, Java, and/or Python.
Evaluating the accuracy and quality of data sources and developing appropriate remedies for data gaps.
Collaborating with business partners in various departments to identify opportunities for process improvements utilizing decision tools to develop project proposals and manage projects.
Working with application development teams to integrate developed models into a production environment.
Collaborating with various departments to identify opportunities for process improvement by using decision tools to develop project proposals and manage projects to their completion.¬†
Identifying complex problems and review related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.



¬†
Skills Preferred:¬†

Railroad business knowledge for general service design principles, including railroad blocking, train scheduling and routing algorithms.
Railroad business knowledge for how to measure and analyze train performance.
Demonstrated knowledge of:
Software development methodology.
Gurobi, CPLEX, or other optimization solvers.
LINUX or UNIX platforms.
Programming languages for software development such as C/C++, Java, or Python.
Database programming languages such as SQL.


Work Conditions
Environment: Hybrid on-site and remote work per week.¬†
Shift Work: No
On-Call: Yes
Weekend Work: No¬†
¬†
Company Overview
Since 1827, Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) and its predecessor companies have safely moved the goods and materials that drive the U.S. economy. Today, it operates a customer-centric and operations-driven freight transportation network. Committed to furthering sustainability, Norfolk Southern helps its customers avoid 15 million tons of yearly carbon emissions by shipping via rail. Its dedicated team members deliver more than 7 million carloads annually, from agriculture to consumer goods, and is the largest rail shipper of auto products and metals in North America. Norfolk Southern also has the most extensive intermodal network in the eastern U.S., serving a majority of the country‚Äôs population and manufacturing base, with connections to every major container port on the Atlantic coast as well as the Gulf of Mexico and Great Lakes. Learn more by visiting www.NorfolkSouthern.com.
¬†
At Norfolk Southern, we believe in celebrating our individuality. By leveraging the unique backgrounds and viewpoints of our employees, we can create a culture of innovation, respect, and inclusion. We know that employees thrive in a workplace where differing viewpoints, ideas, and experiences are freely shared and valued. As such, we encourage all employees to contribute their distinctive skills and capabilities to our organization.
¬†
Equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetic information, veteran status, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Together, we power progress.

Norfolk Southern offers a unique opportunity to be part of our proud legacy that spans nearly 200 years. We are a customer-centric, operations-driven team dedicated to advancing safety, serving communities, and driving innovation for tomorrow's rail.¬†¬†As part of Norfolk Southern, you‚Äôll join a collaborative team where there are opportunities for growth across the organization. We are building a culture where everyone can thrive by owning and driving exceptional results, being humble and leading with trust, serving our customers with excellence, and collaborating and coaching to win.

Job Description

Norfolk Southern Corporation is seeking a Senior Operations Research Specialist based in Atlanta, Georgia. This position will be responsible for providing management with recommendations for the use of analytical models and decision support systems to drive productivity and efficiency, achieve operational excellence, increase revenues, and reduce costs. This individual will be required to telecommute to the office in alignment with Norfolk Southern‚Äôs office/remote hybrid work policy.¬†

Responsibilities

  • Provide production support and enhancements for existing operations research applications.
  • Design new mathematical or machine learning models and implement them in programming languages such as C/C++, Java, and Python.
  • Evaluate the accuracy and quality of data sources and develop appropriate remedies for data gaps.
  • Collaborate with business partners in various departments to identify opportunities for process improvement.

  • Apply understanding of industry best practices, optimization, methodologies, and emerging technologies in operations research.¬†
  • Provide leadership to various groups to achieve goals by creating an environment that promotes positive communication, encourages bonding of team members, and demonstrates flexibility.
    ¬†

Education:

  • Advanced degree, e.g., Ph.D. or M.S. in industrial engineering, operations research, information systems, mathematics, statistics, or other science and engineering fields is preferred.¬†
  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in computer science or management information system is required.¬†

¬†

Skills Required:¬†

  • Minimum of five (5) years of experience with operations research modeling, simulation, and advanced analytics in the transportation or railroad industry. ¬†
  • This experience must include at least five (5) years of experience:
    • Developing decision support systems using operations research models.
    • Managing projects and providing hands-on leadership in the design and development of operations research models and decision support systems.
    • Utilizing operations research techniques and engineering skills in delivering decision support systems.
    • Analyzing existing operations research applications and providing production support and enhancements.
    • Designing new mathematical and machine learning models and implementing them in programming languages such as C/C++, Java, and/or Python.
    • Evaluating the accuracy and quality of data sources and developing appropriate remedies for data gaps.

    • Working with application development teams to integrate developed models into a production environment.

¬†

  • Railroad business knowledge for general service design principles, including railroad blocking, train scheduling and routing algorithms.

  • Software development methodology.

  • LINUX or UNIX platforms.

  • Database programming languages such as SQL.

On-Call: Yes

Company Overview

Since 1827, Norfolk Southern Corporation (NYSE: NSC) and its predecessor companies have safely moved the goods and materials that drive the U.S. economy. Today, it operates a customer-centric and operations-driven freight transportation network. Committed to furthering sustainability, Norfolk Southern helps its customers avoid 15 million tons of yearly carbon emissions by shipping via rail. Its dedicated team members deliver more than 7 million carloads annually, from agriculture to consumer goods, and is the largest rail shipper of auto products and metals in North America. Norfolk Southern also has the most extensive intermodal network in the eastern U.S., serving a majority of the country‚Äôs population and manufacturing base, with connections to every major container port on the Atlantic coast as well as the Gulf of Mexico and Great Lakes. Learn more by visiting www.NorfolkSouthern.com.

At Norfolk Southern, we believe in celebrating our individuality. By leveraging the unique backgrounds and viewpoints of our employees, we can create a culture of innovation, respect, and inclusion. We know that employees thrive in a workplace where differing viewpoints, ideas, and experiences are freely shared and valued. As such, we encourage all employees to contribute their distinctive skills and capabilities to our organization.

¬†
